awd_titl_txt: Alkylation of Isobutane with Light Olefins:  Mechanisms and Process Improvements for Higher Quality Alkylates
awd_abstract_narration: The purpose of this work is to clarify the mechanism of sulfuric-               acid-catalyzed alkylation of isobutane with light olefins, and to               apply the knowledge obtained to modify alkylation processes to                  improve product quality and/or reduce operating expenses.                       Alkylates (produced by alkylation) are blended into gasoline at                 refineries to improve octane rating, increase volatility, and                   decrease viscosity.  Both one-step (the present standard) and                   two-step alkylation processes will be investigated.  Among the                  variables to be considered are temperature, composition of the                  acid phase (water, polymer, surfactant, and other additives), and               viscosity.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
